definition: hoodlum/bad guy
evil/fierce/vicious/ugly/coarse/to harm
see 惡心|恶心[e3 xin1]
to hate/to loathe/ashamed/to fear/to slander
disciple/apprentice/believer/on foot/bare or empty/to no avail/only/prison sentence
surname Tu

sentences.chinese: 惡徒攻擊範圍由6恢復至5。

sentences.english: It raps us on the head like a bully.
sentences.chinese: 它像惡徒一樣在我們面前逞威風。

sentences.english: They ensured good behaviour by having miscreants publicly flogged.
sentences.chinese: 他們通過公開鞭打那些惡徒來確保良好的行爲規範。

sentences.english: Mrs. taylor deplored the state of affairs caused by the evil person .
sentences.chinese: 泰勒夫人爲這惡徒所造成的局勢感到悲痛。

sentences.english: A scoundrel and villain, who goes about with a corrupt mouth.
sentences.chinese: 無賴的惡徒，行動就用乖僻的口。

definition: fight to the death/desperate struggle
to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to murder without blinking an eye (idiom)/ruthless/cold-blooded
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy

Feast at Hongmen/(fig.) banquet set up with the aim of murdering a guest/refers to a famous episode in 206 BC when future Han emperor Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1] escaped attempted murder by his rival Xiang Yu 項羽|项羽[Xiang4 Yu3]
shameful secret
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
the guilty party files the suit/the thief cries thief
stupid and ignorant (idiom)
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
to be buried in a horse hide (idiom)/to give one's life on the battlefield
to be drowned (figurative and literal)
